rationales.benevolence: Lends money to cousin Diego for his girls' school shoes despite financial strain: 'His girls needed new shoes for school and what was I supposed to do, just say no?'
rationales.security: Explicitly chooses financial instability to help family: 'I'd rather be broke and know I showed up for people than comfortable.'
rationales.hedonism: Sacrifices personal comfort for others: 'I'd rather be broke... than comfortable and wondering if I did enough.'

rationales.benevolence: Uses limited break time during 12-hour workday to help family: 'Picked up tia Elena's medication on my break because the pharmacy was on my route anyway.'
Emotional response to family reciprocity and concern for the children: 'His girls wanted to give me their piggy bank money... I told them to keep it but I cried in the car after.'

rationales.tradition: Learns and preserves multi-generational family recipe: 'She taught me her mother's recipe, the one with the olives.'
rationales.benevolence: Invests quality time with close family: 'Spent the whole afternoon together, just us and the masa.'
Sacrifices personal resources for brother: 'He's my little brother; that's just what you do.'
rationales.security: Delays essential car maintenance to send money: 'maybe skip the new tires for another month.'
rationales.hedonism: Picks up extra shifts and sacrifices personal needs: 'It means I pick up extra shifts... It's fine, I've done it before.'

rationales.benevolence: Deep concern for aunt's wellbeing and considering having her move in: 'What if next time it's worse? I've been thinking about asking her to move in with me.'
Hosts and cooks for extended family/community: 'watching everyone eat my food and laugh... this is why I do everything. These people, this noise, this mess.'
rationales.tradition: Maintains cultural celebrations and customs: 'we did the grape thing at midnight' and cooking traditional pernil.
rationales.self_direction: Struggles to prioritize own needs, surrenders self-care to caregiving: 'taking care of myself feels selfish... I just don't know how.'
rationales.hedonism: Running on empty, too exhausted to care for self: 'too tired to cook some nights, just ordering delivery even though I can't afford it.'

rationales.benevolence: Immediately agrees to help without hesitation: 'I said yes before I even finished reading.'
rationales.self_direction: Abandons self-care attempt immediately for others' needs: 'Five minutes in, Diego texted... I said yes before I even finished reading.' Admits in response: 'Like I was choosing myself over them.'
